name: b2 miami downtown

reviews.text: Loved this place and would stay again. Bathroom a little small but a clean and beautiful modern hotel. Took our kids 10 and 12 and we were comfy and happy. Also great location and 5 min from cruise ships. Easy 9 dollar cab ride there too. Close to shops and restaurants and water
reviews.title: Good location and clean, modern with great views of biscayne bay

reviews.text: Recently renovated, very close to the port of Miami. Although the renovations look nice at first glance, they seem a bit cheap to me. Some places in the room aren't very clean, such as the corners and underneath the sink. The room I stayed in was extremely spacious, though. I would stay here again for a pre-cruise hotel.
reviews.title: Nice pre/post cruise hotel

reviews.text: My stay was back in April during their renovations and as such the place was a little untidy throughout the lobby and the hotel itself had no outside signage making it nearly impossible to find.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. I dont mind that room had no mini bar however there were no other conveniences available within the hotel, especially with the bar closing quite early. Whilst there is a 7/11 down the road, walking around downtown miami at night isnt exactly a nice or safe experience, something that the hotel should keep in mind for providing something as simple as a vending machine for bottled water & snacks.
reviews.title: Great location close to Bayside!

reviews.text: The room itself whilst tiny and barely any room for my suitcase, was nice and the bed very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for one night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise in a bayview room. The staff were happy, friendly and efficient for the most part. The Tavern had great food and drinks both in the evening and at breakfast. Location is across from the Bayside Marketplace so plenty of choices are available. CVS is across the street. Did I say how happy the staff seemed? So great to go into a hotel and experience people who enjoy being at work. Very modern, hip look in the lobby. The room was smaller than some and the bathroom was tiny but they were clean and the view and location were wonderful. the bedding was fabulous. We had a great sleep and woke up to a view of the port and our ship. We enjoyed a leisurely morning breakfast buffet (free coffee is available at the Tavern) and a short, easy drive to the port.
reviews.title: Happy Happy Happy describes B2

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt like the valet parking & help with the luggage was a little unorganized but that may be on my part. I am use to driving up and having an attendant immediately take care of my luggage and car. The luggage was going to be left until someone came to get it. I'm sorry but not on a street anywhere. We got them to take it inside and they left it in the floor while we checked in. There should be one person to handle taking luggage from car to room and vice versa. Next time we will just get our own luggage cart.
reviews.title: Perfect location and excellent staff

reviews.text: B2 will definitely be on our list for our next trip to Miami. The staff was by far the friendliest and most helpful we have ever had in a hotel. The room was great and the view second to none. Its so conveniently located downtown.
reviews.title: Undiscovered Gem

reviews.text: Family and I stayed at this hidden Gem on our way to a cruise. The place has a perfect location and the hotel staff was extremely helpful. I do agree with some comments about the size of the rooms, but we were not moving in and the place was clean and very well maintained. Wish we had stayed longer to enjoy the city more but -- next time this is the place to be.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well located in the downtown area, an excellent view of the city, very kind staff who made a pleasant staying. Great to have free room WiFi access, and the morning tea / coffee to start the day. The room was very comfortable for the four of us. We stayed one night prior to take a cruise, so it was a nice opportunity to know the city and doing some shopping before our trip. The bayside marketplace near the hotel is a nice place to walk along, to make some shopping and have some food.
reviews.title: Amazing stay.

reviews.text: I stayed here 8/21 - 8/24, I lucked out with a PH room, the view was great! Carlos was courteous, helpful, and AWESOME by sharing with me a few tips for fun, dining, safety, sightseeing, and helping me with my stuff. Right across the street from a small mall, dining, boat tours, and walking distance to much more. I was traveling alone so the size of the room was perfect for me. Overall, good location, great staff, would recommend to friends and family. I appreciate the great service of all the staff , I had the chance of interacting with. Thanks :)
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.text: Hotel was clean. Room spacious, convenient location, easy access to bus, rail, shopping, site seeing. Air condition on top floor was very noisy. Staff relocated us to a lower floor immediately. Friendly staff. Rooms need to have a coffee maker. Missed having my coffee as I get up.
reviews.title: B2 downtown Miami review

reviews.text: This place is a hidden gem. Recently remodeled and perfectly located if you have business downtown. The tavern is in the lobby and offers a nice selection of food items as well as a marvelous happy hour which I frequently enjoyed. My only caution is be sure to choose an appropriately sized room. If you are traveling with someone, the small room may not suffice. However the rooms, even the small one are chic and super clean. The gym is small too but adequate and very clean. The most impressive part of my stay was by far the staff. First class and professional and well trained. Sig the manager is walking the property often and you can see the positive results. Parking price is similar to neighbor properties so I did not complain. Finally I say give this spot a chance. You should be pleased with what you get for your money. By far the best value in downtown Miami......
reviews.title: Super Locale Super Staff
Terrible Experience
reviews.text: Purchased via HOTWIRE and of course expect the worst room in the Hotel... Tiny space, no window view, EXTREMELY NOiSY AC Unit...The Hotel itself is not a real Hotel...Limited front office almost no lobby attached to a Tavern...Dirty elevators...and front office staff they really make you feel that you purchased a cheaper rate room, so this is what you deserve...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If could avoid it DONT GO...
reviews.title: Loved My Experience Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice and clean hotel. We were a little surprised by how small the room was, but we were only using the hotel as a place to sleep so we didn't care at all. The entire day we were out and about in Miami exploring and just walking around and seeing what the city had to offer. Beds were very comfortable and we had a great sleep before our cruise. I would definitely return! Thank you for a great stay!
reviews.title: Pre cruise stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 2 week stay was amazing. Staff is very attentive and helpful. The place is spotless and neat. We had the chance to stay at 2 different types of rooms, one with the bay view and another with a corner (bay and downtown) view, it was mesmerizing! definitely worth the price.
reviews.title: Great location and impeccable service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant downstairs offered some great options but there are plenty of restaurants and cafes around.
reviews.title: close to the port

reviews.text: Location is great. Bayside Market Place is right in front which has lots fo shops, restaurants, bars (including the Hard Rock cafe). The AA Arena is also at a walking distance. Flagler St. is like 2 blocks away, good for shopping.
reviews.title: Cute spot, nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When i got to this hotel i was delighted to see it is across from the bayside market place with its food areas and parks. The lobby was clean but it was extremely busy due to cruise guests checking out. Some of the items to note was although i picked a bayview suite it was small and compact. The bathroom leaves alot to be desired, although clean it is a very tight squeeze and definately not for 2. Also parking is an issue with costs being approx 25usd per night. As a precruise hotel this is perfect for those wanting a romantic time i would suggest elsewhere.
reviews.title: 1 night

description: Escape to Miami for a chic, urban retreat, and be in the center of it all at the new bayfront b2 miami downtown hotel. Enjoy world class entertainment, pulsating nightlife, and an ever-evolving culinary scene infused with international flair. At the center of the city's financial and business districts, the cosmopolitan hotel grants both business and leisure guests access to everything downtown Miami has to offer. b2 miami downtown features guestrooms adorned with stylish interiors and comfortable features. A relaxing retreat from the energetic city streets, each hotel room showcases views of Miami's colorful skyline, or endless views of Biscayne Bay.
